intro: Corispermum tibeticum, commonly known as the Tibetan sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and small, scale-like leaves adapted to arid conditions. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is well-suited to the harsh climate of its native habitat. Corispermum tibeticum plays a role in stabilizing soil in its environment and is of interest to botanists studying plant adaptations to extreme conditions.
